lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh God!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all a bunch of assholes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That might be the worst one!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Happy to have you guys! Sam, do you have a few words one that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond has a mobile app, guys, and it is out on beta! You can download it now at the App Store and the Google Play Store-- The Apple App Store and the Google Play Store. And because most-- well not most, but a lot of our audience is located in the United Kingdom, I tailored tonight's D&D Beyond pitch to the British audience.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi, mates! Have a butcher's and be gobbed by this brand new D&D Beyond mobile app for your dog 'n' bone!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, Kit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know my onions on this and I ain't all mouth and no trousers! It's a real corker of an app, and you can nick yours on the Apple App Store and blimey, the bloody Google Play Store, too! Are you skint? Tosh! It's free, and that's the dog's bollocks! You don't got to be minted to get sorted. There's nothing bent as a nine bob note about it. You get an ereader with the beta, and character sheets will be added in the future tickety-boo!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a real phrase that I looked up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course it is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So don't faff a dozy fortnight. You'll be right gutted if you do! Oh, sweet fanny adams; don't wag off! Search D&D Beyond at your app store and you'll be jolly good chuffed about it! Oh now I'm knackered and cream crackered so I'm off to Bedfordshire! Pip pip!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh wow!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like that was Masterpiece Theatre all at once.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I refuse to applaud that. I refuse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like that would be real hard to do quickly, so I'm impressed!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's DnDBeyond.com! DND not D&D. Next up, reminder for you guys who have Amazon Prime with Twitch Prime. You can subscribe to any channel on Twitch for free each month. You get one which you can grab for free. Just connect your Amazon Prime and your Twitch account and it's a little button press and there you go. That's awesome. Talks Machina hosted by Brian W Foster, whom I'm tempted to mess up his name every week because apparently I really-- Anyways, he hosts our fantastic Talks Machina wrap-up show about today's episode next Tuesday at 7:00pm Pacific here on Twitch and Alpha, so check it out there and check out whatever cast members show up to dish the dirt and shoot the shit and whatever else involves doing something and something. You got it. Daylight Savings Time hits the US on Sunday.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not true, is it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't know that!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why would they do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's on the list if it's not. I don't know anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We spring forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we lose an hour.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we lose an hour of sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So check out WhenIsCriticalRole.com for an update on when Talks Machina and Critical Role will be live in your timezone if you aren't lucky enough to be living in the Dark Ages like America is when it comes to keeping track of your time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, if you're watching this episode in July of 2019, you're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have a couple other cool announcements. One, issue five of Vox Machina: Origins is out if you haven't seen it yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh man!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beat to shit Vax on the front! It's fucking awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty great!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I still haven't read it! I need to!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam! It's really good. We've already gotten back a good portion of the art for issue six, the end of this arc, and it looks really good. If you haven't had a chance, you can check it out. You can download it on ComiXology, on the Dark Horse Comics app, and many other places where fine comic books are sold digitally.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Laserdisc.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, that too. Let's see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have an announcement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it on the list?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think it might be.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will be leaving late tonight, post-midnight, to fly out to Lexington, Kentucky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, gross, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, but it'll be great. I'll be at the Lexington Toy and Comic Convention to hang out with a bunch of you guys out there in Kentucky! If you haven't already decided to go, and you're in the vicinity, please come! We'll have panels and signings and be around. We can hang out, swap stories, and be general nerds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you leaving from here to there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm leaving from here to home, to pack, and then leaving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You haven't packed!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I had to finish campaign prep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, Matthew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Laura, you had an announcement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I do! Oh my gosh, you guys, merchandise! Number one, the tarot cards, which a lot of people have been asking about, are back in stock right now in the Geek & Sundry store. Number two and three, check out these fabulous, fabulous T-shirts!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: These are new T-shirts!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at this, our throwback shirt! And we redid our logo shirt in new sophisticated--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Darkest timeline Critical Role. Critical Role darkest timeline.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you're looking for them, they're not in the store now. We wanted to announce them--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, they're not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know. They're going to be available next Thursday. We're announcing them right now so that those of you that don't see this live--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: People on YouTube always get mad at us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a little love to YouTube. Now you've got four days to figure your stuff out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Think about the Europes and the other places that are asleeps.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those people you just addressed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're going to be there on Thursday next week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. Thank you, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, everybody, for talking over my fucking announcement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, it's okay, baby. It's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got this, Travis. This is all you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pregnant rage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You son of a bitch!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (pretend cries) You want some pickle juice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Last but not least, we have a cool announcement for an upcoming event. For those of you who are in, around, or planning to visit Chicago in April for C2E2, I think pretty much the whole cast, aside from Ashley who will be filming, will all be there for Critical Role panels, signing events, all that fun stuff. In Chicago, April 7th on Saturday and April 8th on Sunday, we'll be there to party in Chicago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Panels and autographs. We loved the critters that came out to Seattle. Chicago, it's time to represent.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to taste some bratwurst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That can be done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some beers. I want some Chicago-style pizza.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bring all those for Sam at the signing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: By the way, this isn't an announcement, but I think it's important, that I only chose from dice that were given to me in Seattle for my dice that I was rolling tonight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may have picked from the remains, carrion-like, as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to announce a small amount of progress for Laura Bailey, who resisted the urge to keep a super cool d20 for herself, which she wanted to do. She gave it to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was ordered to, so yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hopefully it stays in my bag.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have one final announcement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm telling you now! Promo code Alpha-- no. Promo code for Alpha: Question. 60 days. Go watch shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll a d20 real quick, just for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not bad, I did okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. Last we left off, the newly decided-upon title for this adventuring group was announced to Bryce, and as such you are now referred to as the Mighty Nein.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Nein!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Mighty No, in Zemnian.

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Big nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you guys want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I, Sam Riegel, want to go back and see Pumat Sol again. But that would not make narrative sense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's always tomorrow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a quick case of the room? See if I see anybody suspicious?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Give them the old evil eye?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, first roll of the night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Perception check. Okay, that's not too bad. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, okay. Glancing about, most of the patrons in here range from somewhat dusty, destitute clothing that looks to be torn and ragged at the edges. Some can be farm hands, but most of the farm work you've seen is done on the outskirts of the outer walls of Zadash, but you've also walked through folks in the street that sit on the side peddling handcrafted wares and whatever they can muster to try and make ends meet on the outskirts of the city proper. You notice two fairly dressed individuals compared to the rest that are in the process of doing a quick game of cards. You can see a large group of people that are just beginning to gather and keeping an eye out towards the door if anybody else they recognize is going to come in. Looks to be about eight or so strong, with younger half-elf woman or so who, as you guys enter, sees you, glances over, then shakes her head and goes back to conversation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bachelorette party.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, straight up. You can see the whole banner on the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Penis necklaces.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dick whistle. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Except this is D&D so they're real penises.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gnoll penises, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cast Identify on that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten gold a head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm at a bar, that's the way it goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see one of the barkeeps leaves behind and gives a finger off to the other one to pick up the slack. The one leaving looks to be an elven woman, what would look to be the equivalent of a human 40s or so, so who knows how long her actual elven age is. Looks graceful, looking a bit disheveled, hair pulled back and tied into a small haphazard bun, simple apron, washing up her hands and toweling them off as she passes off the full bar to a male dragonborn. White-scaled, plump physique, he himself is wearing a similar apron with a big smile on his face. He seems jolly, rushing back and forth taking orders, filling drinks, and looks like even though he's a bit stressed at the moment, having to take the slack, is handling it with a smile and is used to the usual evening ruckus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And so the two, the dragonborn and the female elven lady seem to be running the joint.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They seem to be, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Copy that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I figure we want some drinks and food, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And also we should rent some rooms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Jester, it looks like there's a game of cards going on over there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay, I will--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just tossing it out there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't have to take my--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or you could eat first; we've been traveling--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Alles gut?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything is good?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: People in it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is accurate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sir, can I bother you for a second?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that point, and hand comes up and he goes, "Excuse me, just a moment." Fills up two tankards on the side, slides them down a bit, grabs a couple silver, pockets it, comes back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's busy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Turns back to you, and maybe a good solid inch or two taller than you, a burly-looking dragonborn--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whistles)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's not that tall. You're not Grog anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a dangerous-looking front of the snout, that as soon as it spins to you and he looks at you with this big, toothy grin, you can see scars in areas where it's been split in the past. This guy's seen some rough action in his past. But as soon as the large dragon mouth curls up into this smile, the golden yellow eyes peeking from behind these stark white scales, themselves look a bit dusty--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: White scales?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. "Right, so what can I do for you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, can we just grab any booth or table that's available? We're looking for some food and drink this evening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pick a table, sit a spell, rack up. You paying up front, or you like a tab?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think a tab. Yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A tab with a conversation of possible rooms for rent later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh. How many rooms you looking? (louder) I'll be right with you, hold your shit! Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many rooms you got?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks under the counter real fast. Pulls out a small board.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three rooms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, we got plenty, we've got like seven of them open. Three rooms, and a tab under the name--"

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Nein.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nein.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just Nein.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nein will do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's six of you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: N-I-E-N, Nein.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, Zemnian. Fucking weird. All right."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is one of the languages of the country.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a lovely language.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Me? I'm Wessek the Trim."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wessek the Trim.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have the same middle name!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Purveyor of the bar here--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is he, in fact, trim?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he is a plump dragonborn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just checking if it was an ironic nickname or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has lived a happy midlife. "I'm purveyor of drinks and keeper of food here at the Leaky Tap. Happy to get your food orders in, get some drinks to your table. Sit back, relax. There's usually a show at some point in the night."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm hopping over to the card game.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to tag along beside her. Hey, do I see any other goblins in this bar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. In fact, from your height, just a lot of bums.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A lot of butts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A whole lot of butts in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to assume that I'm okay then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any other half-orcs in this bar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not see any half-orcs in this bar. As you go over to the table, the two gentlemen who are playing cards, you sit down and glance. One of them looks to be an older man in his 50s or so, his pattern baldness curling back, but has this curled mush of brown, now graying, hair on the outskirts of it. He's wearing a billowing shirt of a nicer silk. That's why it caught your eye. These two seem, not extremely well-off by any means, but at least better than a lot of the other riff-raff that are finding their way in, including you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My dress is nice, I don't know what you're talking about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true. The other one is in the process of heavily concentrating on his hand. This one looks a lot younger. He has this scraggly mustache. It looks like he's probably been growing it since childhood, and has let it go in its glory. He has a button-up high collar bit and a cravat that has loosened and fallen. Both of these gentlemen, upon a closer look, look like they're dressing up beyond their station, and at the end of the night have come to alleviate their stresses with drink and yelling at each other over cards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hop, hop. I sit down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are we playing? Are we playing Go Fish, or War, or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both stop mid-conversation and glance over. "We're playing whatever suits us at the moment. We're in the midst-- "

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is suiting you right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, we are in the moment finishing a quick game of poker. If you would be so kind as to leave us to our game in peace, that would be appreciated."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will play with you! I'm not very good, so you can take so much money from me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes! Grift it, girl!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am watching this from the table. This is the show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. The younger one, who was talking to you, glances over to the older gentleman, who's in the process of glancing back, and they take a moment and they both look back to you together. "I suppose, if you want to buy in, then that is your choice."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can finish your game though, I'll just watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They wordlessly continue the game. They begin arguing over the process of rising prices between irons coming down from the Druvenlode city, which is one of the larger mining cities in the empire. They begin to also discuss the quality of alcohol, seems to be diminishing the more they drink. Eventually, with one final hand, the younger one slaps down his cards, and the older one in frustration goes, "Fine! You win."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I applaud the younger guy. What do you want to play, Nott? Do you want to play?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just watch for now. Do you want me go get you a drink and bring it back, or are you okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, unless you want to get some milk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just watch for now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. What is the buy-in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do you wish to play?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the sake of ease of the sudden card game, he looks around at the other guy. "Do you know the Crick-Queen's Call?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do! I love it, this is the one I was telling you about!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, remember, with the three cards?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes, I remember.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well, then." He goes to shuffle the cards rather rapidly before he begins dealing out the early sets.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it a clean shuffle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would watch that, too. Are you watching this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope, I don't see shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would be watching this, too, because I'm kind of a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A question. Is there any rafters, or any high place in the room behind these gentlemen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are rafters, yeah. It's not a very high peaked ceiling. The actual roofing element of this, at least, begins about twelve feet up, and there's a small space before the beams meet the top.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For the moment I scootch Frumpkin down to the floor and send him off towards behind these gentlemen to hang around under that spot, for the moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22 perception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems to be a clean shuffle, and a clean deal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we put two gold in, or some silver?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both the guys look at each other again, their eyes a little wide. "Two gold would suffice, yes. Of course."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He strokes his way-too-soft mustache.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not-all-there mustache.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, I think you're too young to be watching this. You should come sit with me over here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's very fascinating, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's a bad idea. You're too little for gambling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not too little, Nott, you're not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She doesn't think I am, but if Caleb says so, then I should go with Caleb. Good luck!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Use your skill.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm confused. Is she actually that young, or is that part of the game?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come, let us go sit over here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that part of the scam?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walked away from this one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two gold on the table from each of you, so that's six gold in the full pot. Go ahead and make your roll, 3d6.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh. What do you do, take the best two? What do you do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone rolls, and then you can raise your ante.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. I'm going to try to use one of my own cards and try to replace one of the cards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight of hand check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin climbs up into the rafters with a view of the gentleman's cards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I try to perceive this too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you do not. They all look at their hands. The younger one with the mustache keeps stroking the front of his face and goes, "I'll raise four." You don't roll yet. You have to raise first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought I was trying to cheat and replace one of my things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you were. Yes, you're right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I get to choose what it is, or do I roll again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just roll again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I rolled it. It was shit. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Raising an additional two gold pieces."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to start looking at their cards through Frumpkin's eyes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm definitely raising two. From your two, I'm going to add in another three. So five extra on the table.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (quietly) Get ready to use your wire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm pulling out my thin bit of wire and I'm getting ready to cast Message.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The older one--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Folds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he stays.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. The younger one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. That's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. Yeah, you can see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll cover my ears so I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're about to know when I whisper it to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The younger one has a crap hand. He's trying to bluff and he's already sweating a bit. The older one is looking really good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Tell our friend that Mr. Mustache is sitting pretty and the young boy has

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the mustache is the younger one. The older one is--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Reverse that order please. Also, I would like the curly fries.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I point to her and whisper in my bit of copper wire and do a little hand gesture, and say all of that to her. The young one's bluffing! The old one's got a sick hand! He's going to burn you! Burn you good!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hmm. I'm going to sleight of hand and try and replace one of my cards.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jesus! In one game?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so go attempt it again. Go and roll a deception-- or sorry sleight of hand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are so honed in on this!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The young guy is sweating a bit and he gets more nervous. He just continues to stroke his little caterpillar mustache, quicker and smaller bits. The older guy who seems to be playing rather spacey the whole time suddenly zooms in on your hands and goes, "I do say, I think we're being had."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, by who?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He leans forward and pulls one of the cards that you had slipped into your sleeve, out onto the table.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was really obvious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The smell of alcohol and dirt wafts off of him as he leans forward. "I will not report you for cheating, but we will taking the rest of the pot."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, cheating? What are you talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He just takes the coins and scoops them up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They get up and leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Motherfuckers, they took my money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you win?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes Nott, I won real good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I knew you would.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I only lost seven gold. That was a lot of fun, you guys. That was a good trick with the messages!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It didn't seem to help very much, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but it would have if I had succeeded in these-- gosh I really need to get tighter sleeves, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but that one had potential.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Molly, you have to teach me how to do that better, okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She wants to play again, right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? I said you want to play again, don't you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing) So bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah Laura's dying on the inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (yells)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we follow them outside and kill them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh. No, probably not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That doesn't seem very nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't instead we have something to drink and eat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I agree with you 100%.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what else we should do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Follow them outside and rob them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly, come on now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we get rooms?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We did get rooms.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay. Are we roommates?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Roomies!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are able to use your meal and figure out who you want to talk to, what you want to do, your business.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should look for Claudia.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We were told that there was Claudia Sheet here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sheed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sheed. Sheedy. Ally Sheedy is here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh I love her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sheed or Sheen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sheed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Charlie Sheen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only I get to say

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's probably the elven woman working at the bar since we were told she works here, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Claudia Sheed?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Claudia Sheed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's ask about--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (yelling) Claudia Sheed!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, go get her, Molly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's up in her office, sorry."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Brilliant, thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was very effective.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I normally find shouting people's names really loudly tends to bring them to your table.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. I wonder where her office is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could ask.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could look. Have we had food and drink yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (various eating noises)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott has to roleplay every meal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What time of the evening do I know it to be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, it's probably pushing close to ten o'clock.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sun's been set for a couple hours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's late. It's not that late.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anybody feel like going up and giving ole Claudia a door rap, at her office?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought you were going somewhere else, for a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm interested either way. So I'm going to stand up and start heading upstairs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm bored. Let's go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come, Unpleasant One, let's go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Obnoxious One, I'm with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has no name on it, but it stands alone from the rest of it, and it seems to be in the direction as to where Wessek was pointing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to look for what looks like an office. For whatever door seems most inconvenient.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At a quick glance, the one on the landing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The one on the landing it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: (click and knock the same pattern)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What the fuck was that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, y'all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've been hanging out far too long. This is a problem. There's a moment. "Yes, who is it?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Friends from out of town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "More information, please."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bryce sent us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bryce who?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bryce from Alfield.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I am. We went up there, I thought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Crownsguard Bryce.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: From Alfield.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, just a moment, please." About 30 or so seconds pass and the door opens, and the same elven woman you saw leave from behind the bar earlier. However, the disheveled appearance you saw earlier is gone, is pristine, clean and the hair is immaculately combed and pulled up into a high bun, wearing a deep maroon, almost a silk robe that is pulled over, arms across.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was desanitizing him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, fair enough. "So you are friends of Bryce."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have come from very far to take a look--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Converse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Converse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, they are a very good friend. And if you are friends of them, then you are friends of "mine. I ask you to enter for the time being and perhaps we can get to know each other, I suppose, "if you have business. Enter, please." She turns and whips around and heads back inside. This office is a simple office. When you consider most of the offices you've encountered have been in some level of empire clerical work, and/or in various institutions, this is mainly just a desk with a chair, some books and ledger information, some scattered papers, ink and quill, a few books on the side. Other than that, it's pretty barren and simple. There is a window in the back that has a crossbeam bisecting it into four squares. It is just pitch black outside 'cause the rest of it is just an alley below. Anyway, she turns around and sits in the chair and comes back, and crosses her hands in front of her with her elbows on the edge of the table. "All right, you have my attention. What can "I do for you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, to wrap it up a bit, we've just recently got into town. We're looking for employment, odd jobs. We were recommended to you to be the person to talk to about what actually is going on in this city. We're new to this city, we don't necessarily have our thumb on the pulse of what's going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are here looking for work? Well, for one, if you are in need of paying work, I always "have dishes to wash. But at a quick glance at how you are presented as a little more capable "individuals at first glance, I would say that perhaps you have other skills. So I would--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do the dude at a bar thing and push up my biceps.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you are better with a blade or information, then checking at the King's Hall Board "might be a solid bet for you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We just figured we would make sure that you were aware we were here. We don't want to ruffle any feathers and we don't necessarily know who are the right people, the wrong people to work for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Every person you meet is the right and the wrong person, depending on where you are coming from."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I guess I would ask what for you is the wrong type of people?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shitty people.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we'd like to avoid entanglements with the law, being so new and all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, then perhaps do not punch any crownsguard and I think you'll be okay."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sounds easy, except it's really not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It does seem like crownsguard tend to be assholes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Deeply punchable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you ever had any issues with the Crownsguard? We've heard rumors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, individuals, yes." There's a brief moment where she looks wistfully into the distance. "I've had my encounters, not so much with Crownsguard, but with other figures."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we need to kick someone's ass for you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I've already made sure their ass has been thoroughly kicked."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe it might be wise to ask any particular groups to avoid while we're here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Interesting point. Where are you from? Have you "always lived in the empire?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm from Nicodranas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From the Menagerie Coast. You are in for a treat of comparably colorful times. But a probably "less jovial atmosphere in places. You know about the religious control, correct?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're slightly aware.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, they frown--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grace of the Platinum Dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most cities contain a shrine of some kind to the "approved worships. I just want to ensure that, if you do not fall into this realm, you do not go "flashing it about, because that will get you very easily put into the Umber Dungeon and that is not "a place you want to be."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where are these shrines that you are talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They are scattered about. For instance, there is the Allhammer. Their shrine is-- let me "think for a second," as I consult my notes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, getting the good shit right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Umber Dungeon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Umber Dungeon. "There is the Hearth of the Allhammer that is existing in the Pentamarket."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, we were just there!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look for the domed iron structure. It may be a bit rusty, not in the best upkeep. It's hard "to miss the interior with the very heavy, beautiful anvil, for both craftwork of those that "maintain a position. What else do you want to know about it? There is the Raven's Den, which is in the center of the graveyard."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounds good, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Ossuary Gates is the multilayered catacomb graveyard. The Raven's Den exists in the "center area of that field."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do the shrines usually have a lot of people in them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Midday, and depending on which places of worship they are, yes. But there are Heralds that "run each shrine; they work for the empire. They hold all sermons. They give council to anybody who "requires it. It's all pretty much within the government structure, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any particular groups of people that are responsible for unsavory business in the city? Any identifying clothing or memorabilia they might have on them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not visibly, no. There are many people that work underneath the law here, but they are careful "enough, if they wish to continue business, to not show it. I mean, what, are you looking for that "kind of work?'

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, just perhaps to keep an eye out for in case we sought employment from the wrong type.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, tourists. We have that tourist look.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Speaking of tourist looks, how much of a problem would this be in general?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You should be fine. It's-- you should be fine."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For the most part, those of various unique heritages have harder times at the farther "eastern areas, around the garrisons. Those that have to keep the creatures of Xhorhas at bay, and "possibly historians that believe that this is the Curse of Ghor Dranas, but you know. For the most "part, most nobody studies history and just consider you either unique-looking or will avoid you regardless."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, no one studies history, really? Do you not have a good public school system or something? I was just curious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if you want to go study history--" that would be over here. "In the Interstead Sprawl, we "do have the Apple Tree Tutor Village. That is three long buildings owned and provided by the "Soltryce Academy for basic learning to children and adults of the less affluent lifestyle for a "moderate price."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like private school?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're looking for a comparison here, it would be upper-end public school, if anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Charter school?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Magnet programs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, we'll put it at a charter school.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lotteries are a bitch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But controlled by the Soltryce Academy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All controlled by the Soltryce.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. "The head tutor there is an overworked and relatively stressed-out individual."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Head tutor, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Mikael Drom. Very nice fellow. Eager to help, but the system has been difficult for him."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a shrine to the Dragon, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is. There is a Platinum House. That would also be in the Interstead Sprawl. Look for "the beautiful white building with deep blue tapestries on the outside. They're reflective, "mirror-like, during the day. It's almost a beacon for having to shield your eyes. Meditation, "worship, is all available within there. Sermon's usually around noon."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any unsanctioned shrines?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anything that isn't the Platinum Dragon, the Raven Queen, Allhammer, Dawnfather, Lawbearer, "and the Knowing Mistress."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So six, that's it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are six."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six approved gods.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All of those guys. Of course we knew about those guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, now, that doesn't seem to cover who you're looking for, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, you know--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't judge. If you worship what you want, you can, just be careful about it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't tell anyone."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ixnay on the angers-stray.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay! I won't tell anyone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's going to tell everyone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's going to help you. Anything else you want to know? I've been living here most of my life."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Job postings. Anywhere we might go to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's where the job postings are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "King's Hall is a good resource. If you're really hit up hard and you want to try the route "that Bryce did, you can always sign up to become a member of the military."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go fuck yourself! No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It works well for some people. It pays, you are trained. The Righteous Brand is very helpful "and helps keep the Empire safe from the terrors that wander in and beyond the borders."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're also always big fans of underbellies, especially if there's an underbelly with a heart of gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Especially one if it's furry and you can pet it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Keep your ears open, ask the right questions."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are there names that, if we hear, we should trust?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't trust anybody. That's how I'm still alive and that's how I came to own this tavern."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Great corner office, by the way. You have a window!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I had to change it a bit. The man I took it all from, I wanted him to leave nothing behind."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he perchance named The Gentleman?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her expression darkens and she goes, "No, but I "would be very careful how you use that name."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really, now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do not know him, but I know of him. That thing I said about trying not to get in trouble "with the darker elements of the city that might be in over your head? That is very specifically one "who wallows in that mire."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He wallows in the underbelly shit? That's what you said? That's me asking the DM.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) Wallows in the mire of the underbelly shit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's the second verse.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, thank you for your time. I think we'll find our way back down to the belly of this tavern.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. I will walk you down."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to touch on something happening-- I'm not there. We're not there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I want to touch on something that's happening at the same time, but I will wait until you think it's a good moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. You can do it now while they're exiting the office. While they've been in there--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Nott and Caleb didn't go up. They're busy. Would you like to learn something interesting?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A magic trick?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sort of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a little homework and a little bit magic trick. This is where I keep my spells. This is my book. And this is the piece of luck that you helped me achieve in Trostenwald. Over the months and years, I gather the amount of magic tricks that I can do. So in this book, for instance, there is a new spell that I do not even know how to use myself where I can make an invisible helper. What is going to happen now, I bought supplies for it-- I find a booth for us in the corner-- is I am going to move it from here into here and I thought you could help me. Would you like to do that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. So you can see--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Photocopying!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Xerox!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what that means, but this will take a little while. Here, hold this. I hand a quill to her. Hold that. You can see the markings on this page. It's intricate, but you can do the first few strokes. It needs to look like that, it needs to go here. I guide her hand a little bit to make sure that it doesn't smudge too much. It's still workable. Good. Now I will fill in the details. I spend the next-- they are probably gone for 15 minutes-- putting down the glyphs and the markings.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's delightful!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And begin the first 30 minutes of the two hours I need to spend copying this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Too much. I'll need to be plied with many drinks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Sliding them over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's my penmanship?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So far, so good. We'll see how it progresses. As you guys exit the office, at the bottom of the stair, you can see that group that was gathering earlier, with the young girl that was looking out towards the entryway, is there waiting at the base of the stair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The bachelorette party?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Though it was a mixed group. As soon as you exit with Claudia, they notice her, notice you, and all step back for a moment and wait. As you step down the stairs, a young half-elf girl, freckled, auburn hair, a smudged face of a hard day's work, leans forward and goes, "Terribly "sorry, Claudia. Are we good to use the cellar for the meeting?" "Yes, of course. It is available to "you right now. Not a problem." She goes, "All right, thank you very much." She turns around and begins gathering up the crew. You can see a few people at the bar, she's slowly gathering the folk until there's a cluster of about 20 or so. They all begin making their way towards where the kitchen is into a pantry area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they going to have an orgy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to have to follow to find out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm asking that of Claudia.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Out loud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "No, not so much. They are passionate political debaters."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you helping run some underground clubs?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just right out in the open, huh?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In your cellar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I am merely providing a space for people that are wanting to work through some "difficulties they have with their lifestyle. That is all."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm running to find Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like latticework, you have to do the smaller circle inside the larger.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have to do this with every spell?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Each one's a little bit different.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispering) Caleb!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're busy here!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're really right in the middle of something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's all right, we just need your cat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I trail with Fjord! I want to know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As we're heading down, I lean over to Beau.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin climbs up Molly's back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm tossing Frumpkin in the direction of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you doing with my cat?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In the basement!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you have to look through his eyes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You won't be able to see anything!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The two of us are going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go to the base-- look, the circle goes inside the larger circle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is the "a e" that's one letter?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that intentional?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was just an observation. Like commenting on the office window? You've gotta put more smile--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, but that was badass! She had a cool fucking office, I guess.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It didn't quite sound that way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, no?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Just something to put in your hat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, maybe we pick this up later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I try it with you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've just mastered the 'f' that looks like an 's'!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're really attractive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, so let's start with maybe a little smile on the face. That's always a good starting point. Try again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're really attractive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh man, you look constipated.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that worse somehow?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You ever winked at anybody?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're really attractive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll keep workshopping it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No? That still wasn't it? Fuck. Thank you. At least thanks for telling me. Most people would just be like, "You're a bitch," and then would leave.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been around you long enough that I can tell you were actually trying to be nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, man. I think you're real nice, too. Genuine! I was being genuine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of you have wrapped up for the time being.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just wanted to borrow some parchment. Do you have any extra pieces of paper, though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much do you need? For what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. Like 20 pieces.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need to write a long letter?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A really long one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll give you two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can make do with that, yes. Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hand them over.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I need to know what your cat's seeing. What's the cat seeing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I've got you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got you, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He puts his hand up and goes, "Hey there. Can we help you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a bunch of people staring at Fjord and Beauregard. Why are we doing this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, for fuck's sake.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Apologies. We don't mean to intrude. We're new to this city. We just heard that some higher thinkers were going to be meeting down here. We hoped we might be able to join you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just looking for good conversation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're making asses of themselves, aren't they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone looks at each other. There's an ornery dwarf fella who looks over to the guy in the top and shakes his head. The half-elven girl who was gathering the group gives a nudge toward you with a smile and says, "We can at least ask." He goes, "All right, well, step on up." The crowd separates a little bit as you guys approach. "I'm curious. Share with me briefly the joys the Empire "has brought to your life."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it's like Alcoholics Anonymous or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be honest."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm afraid my list is not that long, unfortunately.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're a bit skeptical. We're looking for support, just like any other wayward souls in this crazy town.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We seek knowledge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We want to be able to trust our Empire, but maybe we need some reassurance in one way or another.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check with advantage with his help.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Persuasion with advantage? That's good! I got a natural 18 with a plus one, so 19. Just being real vague.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You seem to be on the level. We are a group called the Knights of Requital, and we are "discussing methods of changing the current political unhappiness in the city of Zadash and beyond."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See, we're not the only ones. We felt like something's been missing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tearing at our heart. It's an ache.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. I will continue with my talk, if you don't mind."

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Please, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Preach on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does that name mean anything to Caleb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody else in the group goes (grunt).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (grunts)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About six months ago, she was up late at night picking up food for the night for the two of us in the Pentamarket. She was in the wrong place at the wrong time. There were some street bandits outside the Tri-Spires. They stabbed someone who had run in, ran clean into my wife, just as the Crownsguard descended. She got looped in with them, thrown in jail. I went and fought. There wasn't even a bit of a trial. The High-Rictor sent her straight to the Umber Dungeon, sentenced her 20 years for this business. It's been six months now, I can't even see her. I'm sick of it, and I think it's time we did something." Everyone in the crowd goes (grunts).

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (grunt)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know it's hard now, but I believe we'll have an opportunity soon. Thank you. Thank you to Kara, who has been helping set these meetings up." Points over to the younger half-elf earlier and she nods and a few hands clap. "And to our new members-- I'm sorry, I didn't get your names."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fjord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beau and Fjord, thank you for joining us tonight. It goes without saying, please, if you don't mind, we prefer to keep these conversations personal. For obvious reasons."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If even the most misunderstood discontent leads to unfortunate circumstances."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We understand. Thank you for sharing with us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know I, for one, have had my discontent with the Empire, so it's good to hear we're not alone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. That's requital. I appreciate your time. Rest well, we'll meet soon. Dismissed!" Everyone begins to scatter and make their way back up to the tavern.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We stay down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I'm going to wait behind. Wait to talk to Dolan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Really appreciate what you said.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, thank you. So much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, of course. I understand that you aren't from around here, so don't feel that you have to take too much of this to heart. Best we can do to try and keep spirits up. I believe that we can find a way to exact some change real soon."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It struck a chord. It mirrors a lot of what we've seen since we've been here. Do you meet very often? I'd love to come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, we're scheduled to meet here in the next two days or so. We're gearing up for a couple of important events."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How often are the meetings that heated? That seemed pretty intense.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, personal. Emotional.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It can vary. Anyway, I'm sorry. I really should be going."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where abouts in town do you live?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I live outside of the Apple Tree Tutors."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll probably be staying here the next few days.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. We'll check in with-- what was her name?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's Claudia.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. We'll check in with Claudia if there's any other meetings. Again, appreciate you being so open.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now it's just the two of you there in the cellar below.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's in the cellar?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You going to rob the place there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I just want to know. Is it munitions? Is it meat? Is it booze?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wine? Is there good wine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are large casks, large wooden barrels and casks. This is where major ale storage is set, but none of them are tapped. It looks to be full of crates that are still sealed; unopened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Any good wines? That I would recognize?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None of the wines are kept in this cellar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By the size of the place, you get the sense there's probably more than one storage place here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you scroll your cursor over it, though, the descriptions are all in red.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Can't access that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Talk about an underbelly. That was more than I was expecting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, and I totally called Claudia on it too, and she didn't even come forward. I'm like, you're running some shit! She's running some shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right upfront.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you notice he said thanks for keeping things close to your chest? Are we that transparent?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. I mean, I would say the same thing if I was taking such a chance with people I didn't know, right? I think he's just trying to invest in us a little.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seemed nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I tell Frumpkin to yowl between their legs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (meowing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (yells)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (suppressing a sneeze)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give Frumpkin the finger, hoping Caleb will see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't see it. I'm not looking through it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now I'm just flicking off a cat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You gave us the basics, though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go back up. Fuck it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was spending my time cutting the parchment up into even, little rectangles so I could make them into multiple pieces of paper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We go back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you guys up to?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We were listening to the description of this insanity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I bamfed out of that probably two minutes before it finished, so I didn't get the tail end, but I got the meat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got the meat of it. You watched the people that were in the meeting leave in small groups. They're pacing their exits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, don't believe what you hear. It was a huge orgy. Just naked parts everywhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I figured it was and Caleb was lying to us the whole time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know. Maple syrup. They had little Tic Tacs and all sorts of chocolate chips. Lollipops galore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Usually, in orgies like that, they don't let you stay unless (tongue clicking). You're part of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's not sticky with maple syrup. He's lying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tongue bath.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eww. Nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could make so much money and be heroes in this town as well! Just like we were in the last!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe not that, but quite frankly, those people are reckless, telling you what they told you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it is. The only problem with that would be we were in that meeting at well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As spies!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Except that they told them their real names. And where they're staying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The authorities don't delineate between the real McCoy and the passersby. Just like that man's story. The dwarf.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never trust a group of people. I specifically used to gather people into groups to make them into idiots. It's just what you do. You don't--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you did that to us!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You also traveled with a group of people.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We all hated each other.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a smaller group.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a pretty big group. There's nine of us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you notice how often his logic falls apart?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You just told them your real name!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I told them I'm

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You left out the -regard part! And you mispronounced your name "Ford" when we all know it's Fjord!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Clever!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there? I've only met one other person named Beau.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've literally only met one other person named Beau.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a good nickname. Beau. Beauregard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think his name was not the same Beau as your Beau.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was a different Beau.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a different Beau. I'm going to start folding my little pieces of paper into little trifolds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. What else are you guys doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we're probably good to retire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good night. Thank you. Good night.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is a bathhouse. I'm going there. Anyone who wants to come with me is welcome to do so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aww, I want a bath so bad, but it's so late, Molly!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's just a walk!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it even going to be open at night?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it going to be open at night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go and try and find out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to and try and find out!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I have important work to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll accompany you, just to make sure you don't get killed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll come with you too because I really want a bath.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess I stay behind with Fjord. We talk about the crazy shit we just heard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, because we're fucking spies!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck yeah, man! We'll break the system! Put it in the ground!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's folded like this.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck the man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just happy with my company.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Now, the two of you make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. She's coming as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's really bad. It's because I'm folding paper.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 17. I'm specifically looking for stores.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Four!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do manage to discover the location of The Steam's Respite, but it is closed for the night. It is too late for its functionality.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the way, do we pass Packwearer's Provisions or any of the other fine establishments you've told us about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wander through the Pentamarket, which you can go roundabout to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not on the way, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. Just on the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the way from where you are exiting there, none of those, no. The Pentamarket is pretty much this cluster at the center of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Any shops at all, or is it just--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing too crazy. It looks like most of the stores that are on the outskirts would be simple glassware, the occasional basic blacksmiths for putting horseshoes on and the construction of that, simple armor repairs for whoever needs it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing crazy. Most of the good stuff is in the vicinity you've already been.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know, Nott, I notice. I notice the way that you eye things, on occasion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not stealing anything right now!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not right now and that's fine. And I would hate to get in the way of any of your business. Your business is your business and I'm perfectly fine with that. But it's good to remember that there are people who need what they have. There are people who need every bit of what they have. And there are people who would be much happier if they had a little less.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do I know which is which?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a skill very much worth developing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If the people look like you and Caleb, they probably need it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If they seem grumpy, or angry, and seem overly concerned with an enormous amount of money that they happen to have, or using it to just be mean or cruel to somebody, that's probably a sign that they'd just be much happier if they just knew exactly who liked them and the only way you could ever really know if someone likes you is if you don't have anything over them. And the easiest way to get to that honesty is if you don't have anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you're saying steal from grumpy people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shitty people specifically.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Unless they're grumpy because they don't have enough. Because if you're hungry, you get very angry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do, I do get really mad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You get so angry when you're hungry!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which kind of grumpy is Beau?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter) Beau really needs to know who likes her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! It makes sense when you're in that shirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Passive sports marketing campaign: check!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What about the rest of you guys, anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am just finishing up the spell Unseen Servant before I go to bed so that I will know it in the morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easily enough. You have it copied over without issue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so excited about a long rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before I go to sleep, I'm going to use my little folded papers and make little pamphlets to the Traveler. So it's going to be like, "Have you heard of our lord and savior, the Traveler?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to get us killed!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He sure is the coolest, everyone should worship him, he's the best guy around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're making Tijuana bibles. You're making Tijuana bibles for your religion. Is there going to be nudity and sex in these? Because then it's basically a Tijuana bible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're like this little, because I had to make them out of only two sheets of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How many did you make?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, however many I could make out of two sheets of parchment, so probably like eight or maybe ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say ten and a few that didn't quite-- you got halfway through and like (frustrated noise) tore it up. Okay cool. So the rest of you guys, are you all resting for the evening?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You awake in the morning to the sound of an already muttering tavern floor below you. The smell of food and whatever dried ale has been spilled into the room that you're currently sleeping in. But the day is yours, the morning has arrived, you are welcome to do what you wish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly, do you need to pray over your swords? I don't know how often--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I did it before you woke up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Well next time, could you include me in it? I don't know if maybe it would help me with my skills.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure. Happily.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I appreciate that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be no problem.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Morning, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Beau! You know what we need to do today?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to go to the pillow place and go get some money from my mom!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Your-- okay, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you get money from your mom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not with us in our room right now!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you didn't come downstairs? Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Peeping tom!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How does he do that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do you know? How do you know that it's going to be there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because I asked her for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, but asking isn't the same as confirmation of receiving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, but it's my mom and of course she's going to send me money! You're crazy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Totally. Let's go. I'll go with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's called the Pillow Trove. We need to go there. But we need to look very pretty, so before that, I'm going to see if Molly wants to go get a bath.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. We have to look pretty?

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, that would be, let's see, right around-- Hmm." (singsong) Let me make sure I get this correct for internal consistency. Ah, that would be in the Interstead Sprawl. If you consider the city's triangular shape, there's the pentagram market off-center and a little bit to the west of it, and then there's the East and West Outersteads, which are the outside cusp and the slums and the outside of the main wall; there's the Tri-Spire, which is up north; then there's a section, a quadrant over here, it's a military section in this weird ring that surrounds and bisects them all around the Pentamarket. That's the Interstead Sprawl.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the garrison area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Well, no, that's the more middle-class, central connecting part that holds the rest of the city together.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The library is there.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you are now, you guys are in the Eastern Outersteads, it would be west. And he goes, "Actually (ugh), hold on just a second, I'll get to your meal. Follow me." He comes out from behind the bar and slaps it up, and puts an arm around your shoulder and leads you right immediately outside to the front of the tavern, pushing you along.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "You look over that rooftop there, and you can see that-- " and you see this slowly tapering tower that then curves off at the very top to be a very dome-like pinnacle. The stonework itself appears to be like a smooth concrete looking texture just from this distance, and the way the morning sun is hitting it, half of it is just bright and reflective and really intricate carving and various tiers along the towers. He goes, "That there's the Archive. That's what you're looking for. So just look at that tower and keep going."

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No worries."

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: She

You can see a younger man in his early 20s or so; he has really thin, blondish hair, and he's wearing a tabard that is the same colors as the Crownsguard, but other than that, normal clothing.

Crick kidnappers steal them away in the night! Lock and seal your windows and doors while you slumber! The attack on Alfield has ended! Terrible--" and you approach him at that point.

lines.text: MARISHA. Yeah. Do you want to be about something?

lines.name: LIAM
